case.title: Open Home Screen from Side Menu

step.content: Navigate to the side menu by clicking on the left-side menu icon.
step.expected: The side menu should be displayed on the left side of the screen.

step.content: Click on the 'Home' icon in the side menu.
step.expected: The home screen should be displayed, replacing the current screen.

step.content: Verify that the home screen elements are present and correctly displayed.
step.expected: The home screen should display the main dashboard or welcome message with all expected elements visible and functional.

step.content: Navigate to the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu should be displayed on the left side of the screen.

step.content: Locate the history icon in the side menu.
step.expected: The history icon should be visible and identifiable in the side menu.

step.content: Click on the history icon.
step.expected: Clicking the history icon should expand the history section.

step.content: Verify that the list of chats is displayed.
step.expected: The list of chats should be visible under the history section.

step.content: Expand the list of chats.
step.expected: The list of chats should expand to show all available chats.

step.content: Collapse the list of chats.
step.expected: The list of chats should collapse back to a summary view.

step.content: Select a chat from the list.
step.expected: The selected chat should open and display its content.

step.content: Navigate to the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu is visible and accessible.

step.content: Locate the settings icon in the side menu.
step.expected: The settings icon is visible and identifiable.

step.content: Click on the settings icon.
step.expected: Clicking the settings icon should open the settings section.

step.content: Verify that the settings section is open.
step.expected: The settings section is displayed, and the settings options are visible.

step.content: Check for the presence of theme options in the settings section.
step.expected: The theme options (System, Dark, and Light) should be visible and selectable.

step.content: Select one of the theme options.
step.expected: The selected theme should be applied to the application interface.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu should be displayed on the left side of the screen.

step.content: Locate the 'About' icon in the side menu.
step.expected: The 'About' icon should be visible in the side menu.

step.content: Click on the 'About' icon.
step.expected: The 'About' section should open in a new window or overlay.

step.content: Verify the 'About' section content.
step.expected: The 'About' section should display information about the application, including version details, copyright information, and contact details.

step.content: Check the close buttons in the 'About' section.
step.expected: The 'About' section should have close buttons that allow the user to close the section.

step.content: Tap on the menu icon located at the top-left corner of the screen.
step.expected: The side menu should expand and become visible.

step.content: Ensure that the side menu contains the expected options such as Home, History, Settings, About, and any other relevant options.
step.expected: All listed options should be visible and accessible.

step.content: Tap on the menu icon again to collapse the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu should collapse and become hidden.

step.content: Check if the main content area is accessible and not obstructed by the side menu when it is collapsed.
step.expected: The main content area should be fully accessible and visible.

step.content: Navigate to the application's main page.
step.expected: The main page is displayed with the side menu open.

step.content: Tap the collapse icon on the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu collapses and is no longer visible.

step.content: Verify that the main content area is now fully visible.
step.expected: The main content area is fully visible, and the side menu is collapsed.

step.content: Tap the expand icon to open the side menu again.
step.expected: The side menu expands and is visible again.

step.content: Navigate to the registration page.
step.expected: The registration page is displayed.

step.content: Enter a valid email address in the email field.
step.expected: The email field accepts the input without errors.

step.content: Enter a strong password in the password field.
step.expected: The password field accepts the input without errors.

step.content: Confirm the password by entering it again in the confirm password field.
step.expected: The confirm password field accepts the input without errors and matches the password.

step.content: Click the 'Register' button.
step.expected: The system processes the registration and displays a success message.

step.content: Verify the user is redirected to the login page or a confirmation page.
step.expected: The user is redirected to the login page or a confirmation page indicating successful registration.

step.content: Check the user's email for a confirmation email.
step.expected: A confirmation email is received in the user's email inbox.

step.content: Click the confirmation link in the email.
step.expected: The user's account is confirmed, and they can now log in.

step.content: Navigate to the application's main interface.
step.expected: The main interface of the application is displayed.

step.content: Locate and click on the 'Canvas' tab in the left side menu.
step.expected: The Canvas tab is selected and opens the Canvas workspace.

step.content: Verify that the Canvas workspace is displayed correctly.
step.expected: The Canvas workspace is visible and ready for use.

step.content: Check for any error messages or loading indicators that might indicate a problem.
step.expected: No error messages are displayed, and there are no loading indicators.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the Canvas tab.
step.expected: The Canvas tab is open and visible.

step.content: Locate the close button on the Canvas tab.
step.expected: The close button is visible and clickable.

step.content: Click the close button on the Canvas tab.
step.expected: The Canvas tab closes successfully and is no longer visible.

step.content: Verify that the Canvas tab is no longer present in the application interface.
step.expected: The Canvas tab is not visible in the application interface.

step.content: Open the Canvas.
step.expected: The Canvas should open successfully.

step.content: Locate the zoom in button.
step.expected: The zoom in button should be visible and accessible.

step.content: Click the zoom in button.
step.expected: The content on the Canvas should increase in size, indicating that the zoom in functionality is working.

step.content: Click the zoom in button multiple times.
step.expected: The content on the Canvas should continue to increase in size with each click.

step.content: Open the Canvas application.
step.expected: The Canvas application is successfully opened and the main interface is displayed.

step.content: Locate the zoom out button on the Canvas interface.
step.expected: The zoom out button is visible and accessible on the Canvas interface.

step.content: Click the zoom out button once.
step.expected: The content on the Canvas is resized to a smaller scale, indicating that the zoom out functionality has been applied.

step.content: Click the zoom out button multiple times to further reduce the zoom level.
step.expected: The content on the Canvas continues to resize to a smaller scale with each click of the zoom out button.

step.content: Verify that the zoom level can be adjusted to the minimum scale without any issues.
step.expected: The content on the Canvas reaches the minimum zoom level without any errors or disruptions.

step.content: Open the Canvas.
step.expected: The Canvas opens successfully.

step.content: Zoom in on the Canvas.
step.expected: The Canvas content zooms in.

step.content: Zoom out on the Canvas.
step.expected: The Canvas content zooms out.

step.content: Click the reset zoom button.
step.expected: The Canvas content returns to the default zoom level.

step.content: Verify the zoom level is reset to default.
step.expected: The Canvas content is displayed at the default zoom level.

step.content: Open the Canvas.
step.expected: The Canvas opens successfully.

step.content: Add some text to the Canvas.
step.expected: The text is visible and editable on the Canvas.

step.content: Select the text and copy it using the copy shortcut (Ctrl+C or Command+C).
step.expected: The selected text is copied to the clipboard.

step.content: Paste the copied text into a text editor (e.g., Notepad) using the paste shortcut (Ctrl+V or Command+V).
step.expected: The copied text appears in the text editor.

step.content: Add a markdown element to the Canvas.
step.expected: The markdown element is visible and editable on the Canvas.

step.content: Select the markdown content and copy it using the copy shortcut (Ctrl+C or Command+C).
step.expected: The selected markdown content is copied to the clipboard.

step.content: Paste the copied markdown content into a markdown editor (e.g., Typora) using the paste shortcut (Ctrl+V or Command+V).
step.expected: The copied markdown content appears in the markdown editor.

step.content: Open the Canvas Markdown editor.
step.expected: The Canvas Markdown editor is opened and ready for input.

step.content: Enter a simple markdown text, for example: '# Hello, World!'
step.expected: The markdown text '# Hello, World!' is displayed as a heading in the preview.

step.content: Switch between view options: Editor, Editor and Preview, Preview.
step.expected: The view switches correctly between the Editor, Editor and Preview, and Preview modes.

step.content: Scroll up and down within the editor.
step.expected: Scrolling is possible without any issues.

step.content: Check the Zoom In and Zoom Out functionality.
step.expected: Zoom In and Zoom Out functions work as expected, allowing the user to zoom in and out of the content.

step.content: Click the Reset button to return to the default zoom level.
step.expected: The content resets to the default zoom level.

step.content: Click the Copy button to copy the content.
step.expected: The content is copied to the clipboard successfully.

step.content: Open the Canvas Workflow.
step.expected: The Canvas Workflow opens successfully.

step.content: Add a workflow by pasting the following JSON: { "version": "1.0", "name": "chat_entity", "desc": "Migrated from chat_entity", "initialState": "none", "active": true, "criterion": { "type": "simple", "jsonPath": "$.workflow_name", "operation": "EQUALS", "value": "chat_entity" }, "states": { "none": { "transitions": [ { "name": "initialize_chat", "next": "initialized_chat", "manual": false } ] }, "initialized_chat": { "transitions": [ { "name": "submit_answer", "next": "submitted_workflow_question", "manual": false, "processors": [ { "name": "AgentProcessor.submit_answer_4a45", "executionMode": "ASYNC_NEW_TX", "config": { "calculationNodesTags": "ai_assistant" } } ] } ] }, "submitted_workflow_question": { "transitions": [ { "name": "submit_answer", "next": "processed_question", "manual": true, "processors": [ { "name": "AgentProcessor.submit_answer_b135", "executionMode": "ASYNC_NEW_TX", "config": { "calculationNodesTags": "ai_assistant" } } ] }, { "name": "lock_chat", "next": "locked_chat", "manual": false, "criterion": { "type": "function", "function": { "name": "FunctionProcessor.is_chat_locked_5b22", "config": { "calculationNodesTags": "ai_assistant" } } } } ] }, "processed_question": { "transitions": [ { "name": "rollback", "next": "locked_chat", "manual": true }, { "name": "lock_chat", "next": "locked_chat", "manual": false, "criterion": { "type": "function", "function": { "name": "FunctionProcessor.is_chat_locked_5b22", "config": { "calculationNodesTags": "ai_assistant" } } } }, { "name": "unlock_chat", "next": "submitted_workflow_question", "manual": false, "criterion": { "type": "function", "function": { "name": "FunctionProcessor.is_chat_unlocked_f77c", "config": { "calculationNodesTags": "ai_assistant" } } } } ] }, "locked_chat": { "transitions": [ { "name": "unlock_chat", "next": "submitted_workflow_question", "manual": true } ] } } }
step.expected: The workflow is added successfully and the JSON is parsed correctly.

step.content: Try to edit the workflow.
step.expected: The workflow can be edited successfully.

step.content: Switch between view options: Editor, Editor and Preview, Preview.
step.expected: The view switches correctly between the specified options.

step.content: Scroll up and down within the Canvas.
step.expected: Scrolling within the Canvas works as expected.

step.content: Check Zoom in, Zoom out, Fullscreen, Lock, Unlock, Undo, Redo, Refresh, Close or Exit, Zoom In, and Settings.
step.expected: All the mentioned functionalities work correctly.

step.content: Check the Workflow Meta Data: editor, close buttons, and save button.
step.expected: The Workflow Meta Data editor, close buttons, and save button function as expected.

step.content: Move states and transitions within the workflow.
step.expected: States and transitions can be moved successfully within the workflow.

step.content: Try to edit and delete states and transitions.
step.expected: States and transitions can be edited and deleted successfully.

step.content: Add a new transition and state.
step.expected: A new transition and state can be added successfully.

step.content: Navigate to the main menu of the application.
step.expected: The main menu is displayed.

step.content: Locate and click on the 'Entities Data' tab.
step.expected: The 'Entities Data' tab is opened successfully.

step.content: Verify that all the tabs, close buttons, and rollback button are present and functional.
step.expected: All the tabs, close buttons, and rollback button are present and functional.

step.content: Navigate to the Entities Data tab.
step.expected: The Entities Data tab is opened and visible.

step.content: Click on the close button of the Entities Data tab.
step.expected: The Entities Data tab is closed and no longer visible.

step.content: Verify that the Entities Data tab is no longer present in the interface.
step.expected: The Entities Data tab is not visible in the interface.

step.content: Navigate to the login page.
step.expected: The login page should be displayed with options for Google, Github, and other login methods.

step.content: Click on the 'Log in with Google' button.
step.expected: The Google login authentication page should open in a new tab or window.

step.content: Enter the Google account credentials and click 'Next'.
step.expected: The user should be redirected back to the application after successful authentication.

step.content: Verify the user is logged in by checking the user profile or dashboard.
step.expected: The user profile or dashboard should display the user's information, indicating a successful login.

step.content: Attempt to access a restricted page or feature that requires login.
step.expected: The restricted page or feature should be accessible without prompting for additional login.

step.content: Navigate to the login page.
step.expected: The login page should be displayed with options to log in using Google, Github, and other methods.

step.content: Click on the 'Log in with Github' button.
step.expected: The user should be redirected to the Github authentication page.

step.content: Enter the Github account credentials and submit.
step.expected: After submitting the credentials, the user should be redirected back to the application.

step.content: Verify that the user is logged in successfully.
step.expected: The user's profile information should be displayed, indicating a successful login.

step.content: Check the user's dashboard or homepage for any personalized content.
step.expected: The user should see personalized content based on their Github profile.

step.content: Navigate to the login page and log in using a valid username and password.
step.expected: The user is successfully logged in and redirected to the main dashboard.

step.content: Click on the user profile icon in the top-right corner of the screen.
step.expected: A dropdown menu appears with options including 'Profile', 'Settings', and 'Logout'.

step.content: Click on the 'Logout' option in the dropdown menu.
step.expected: The user is logged out and redirected to the login page.

step.content: Verify that the user is redirected to the login page by checking the URL and the presence of the login form.
step.expected: The URL should be the login page URL and the login form should be displayed.

step.content: Check if any user-specific elements (e.g., user profile icon, dashboard widgets) are no longer visible.
step.expected: No user-specific elements should be visible, indicating that the user is logged out.

step.content: Navigate to the registration page.
step.expected: The registration page should be displayed with all necessary fields available.

step.content: Enter a valid username in the 'Username' field.
step.expected: The 'Username' field should accept the input without any errors.

step.content: Enter a valid email address in the 'Email' field.
step.expected: The 'Email' field should accept the input without any errors.

step.content: Enter a strong password in the 'Password' field and confirm it in the 'Confirm Password' field.
step.expected: The 'Password' and 'Confirm Password' fields should accept the input without any errors and match each other.

step.content: Click the 'Create Account' button.
step.expected: The system should process the registration and display a confirmation message indicating that the account has been successfully created.

step.content: Verify the user account by checking the email for a confirmation link.
step.expected: An email with a confirmation link should be received in the inbox. The link should be functional and clicking it should activate the user account.

step.content: Log in using the newly created account credentials.
step.expected: The user should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard or homepage.

step.content: Navigate to the login page and click on the 'Log in with Google' button.
step.expected: The Google login page should appear.

step.content: Enter invalid Google account credentials (e.g., incorrect email or password) and attempt to log in.
step.expected: The system should display an error message indicating that the login attempt was unsuccessful.

step.content: Verify that the user is not logged in and remains on the login page.
step.expected: The user should not be redirected to any other page and should still be on the login page.

step.content: Navigate to the login page and select the Github login option.
step.expected: The Github login page should be displayed.

step.content: Enter invalid Github account credentials (e.g., wrong username or password) and attempt to log in.
step.expected: The system should display an error message indicating that the login credentials are invalid.

step.content: Check if the user is redirected back to the login page or remains on the same page.
step.expected: The user should remain on the login page.

step.content: Verify that the user is not logged in by checking for the absence of user-specific elements on the page.
step.expected: specific elements should not be visible.

step.content: Log in to the application using a valid account.
step.expected: The user is successfully logged in and redirected to the main dashboard.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface.
step.expected: The chat interface is displayed with no errors.

step.content: Type a message in the chat input field.
step.expected: The message appears in the chat input field as typed.

step.content: Click the send button to send the message.
step.expected: The message is sent successfully and appears in the chat window with a timestamp.

step.content: Check the chat history to ensure the message is saved.
step.expected: The sent message is visible in the chat history.

step.content: Open the chat interface and select a chat prompt from the list.
step.expected: The chat prompt is selected and displayed in the chat input field.

step.content: Click the send button to initiate the conversation with the selected chat prompt.
step.expected: The chat prompt is sent, and the conversation starts with the system's response to the prompt.

step.content: Verify that the system's response is relevant to the selected chat prompt.
step.expected: The system's response is appropriate and related to the chat prompt used.

step.content: Continue the conversation by sending additional messages.
step.expected: The system responds appropriately to the user's messages, maintaining the context of the conversation.

step.content: Check if the chat history is saved correctly after the conversation.
step.expected: The chat history is saved, and the conversation can be viewed later.

step.content: Navigate to the application's main menu.
step.expected: The main menu should be displayed with various options available.

step.content: Click on the 'Open Discord' button.
step.expected: The Discord application should open in a new window or tab.

step.content: Verify that the Discord application is functioning correctly.
step.expected: The Discord application should be fully operational, allowing the user to interact with it as expected.

step.content: Navigate to the Discord login page.
step.expected: The login page should be displayed with options for logging in with Google, Github, and other methods.

step.content: Click on the 'Log in with Google' button.
step.expected: The user should be redirected to the Google login page.

step.content: Enter the Google account credentials and complete the login process.
step.expected: The user should be redirected back to the Discord application and logged in successfully.

step.content: Verify that the user is logged in by checking the user profile or home screen.
step.expected: The user's profile information should be displayed, indicating a successful login.

step.content: Log in to the Discord application with valid credentials.
step.expected: The user is successfully logged in and redirected to the main dashboard.

step.content: Navigate to the user settings by clicking on the user profile icon in the bottom left corner and selecting 'User Settings'.
step.expected: The user settings menu is displayed.

step.content: Click on the 'My Account' tab within the user settings menu.
step.expected: The 'My Account' tab is displayed with the user's account information.

step.content: Verify that the user's profile picture, username, and email address are visible and correct.
step.expected: The user's profile picture, username, and email address are displayed correctly.

step.content: Check if the 'Change Password' button is present and functional.
step.expected: The 'Change Password' button is present and clicking it redirects to the password change page.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface and click on the 'Open Chat' button.
step.expected: A new chat window should open, displaying the chat interface.

step.content: Type a message in the chat input field and press 'Send'.
step.expected: The message should appear in the chat window and the chat should update with the new message.

step.content: Click on the 'Close Chat' button in the chat window.
step.expected: The chat window should close, and the chat list should be visible again.

step.content: Open another chat window by clicking on a different chat in the chat list.
step.expected: A new chat window should open, displaying the chat interface for the selected chat.

step.content: Repeat the process of sending a message and closing the chat for the second chat window.
step.expected: The message should appear in the chat window and the chat should update with the new message. The chat window should close when the 'Close Chat' button is clicked.

step.content: Create a few requests in the chat.
step.expected: The user should be able to create and send multiple requests successfully.

step.content: Navigate to the chat history section.
step.expected: The chat history section should display all the created requests in chronological order.

step.content: Check if the chat history is saved.
step.expected: The chat history should be saved and visible even after refreshing the page or closing and reopening the application.

step.content: Navigate to the chat list and select a chat to delete.
step.expected: The selected chat should be highlighted or marked for deletion.

step.content: Click on the delete button for the selected chat.
step.expected: A confirmation dialog should appear asking if you are sure you want to delete the chat.

step.content: Confirm the deletion in the dialog.
step.expected: The chat should be removed from the chat list and a confirmation message should appear indicating the chat was deleted.

step.content: Check the chat list to ensure the deleted chat is no longer present.
step.expected: The deleted chat should not be visible in the chat list.

step.content: Open the chat that needs to be renamed.
step.expected: The chat window opens with the current chat name displayed.

step.content: Click on the 'Rename' option in the chat settings.
step.expected: A dialog box or input field appears, allowing the user to enter a new name for the chat.

step.content: Enter a new name for the chat and click 'Save' or 'Confirm'.
step.expected: The chat name is updated to the new name, and the chat window reflects the new name.

step.content: Verify that the chat name has been updated in the chat list.
step.expected: The chat list displays the new name for the chat.

step.content: Open the renamed chat and check if the new name is displayed correctly.
step.expected: The new chat name is displayed in the chat header.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface and ensure there are messages present.
step.expected: The chat interface displays with at least one message visible.

step.content: Select a chat message by clicking on it.
step.expected: The selected chat message is highlighted or otherwise indicated as selected.

step.content: click on the selected chat message and choose the 'Copy' option from the context menu.
step.expected: The chat message is copied to the clipboard.

step.content: Open a text editor or any application where you can paste text and paste the copied message.
step.expected: The chat message appears in the text editor or application as pasted text.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface and send a message.
step.expected: The message is successfully sent and displayed in the chat.

step.content: Locate the message in the chat and click on the 'Approve' button.
step.expected: The 'Approve' button is visible and clickable.

step.content: Click the 'Approve' button.
step.expected: The message is marked as approved, and a confirmation message or indicator appears.

step.content: Verify that the message is now marked as approved.
step.expected: The message displays a status or indicator that it has been approved.

step.content: Open the chat interface.
step.expected: The chat interface is displayed.

step.content: Click on the 'attach file' button.
step.expected: A file selection dialog appears.

step.content: Select a file to attach from your local storage.
step.expected: The selected file is attached to the chat message.

step.content: Send the chat message with the attached file.
step.expected: The chat message with the attached file is sent successfully.

step.content: Verify the attached file in the chat message.
step.expected: The attached file is visible and downloadable in the chat message.

step.content: Open the chat interface and navigate to a chat message that contains a prompt and a link.
step.expected: The chat message should display the prompt and the link correctly.

step.content: Hover over the link within the chat message.
step.expected: The link should display a tooltip or a preview of the linked content.

step.content: Click on the link within the chat message.
step.expected: The link should open in a new browser tab or window, leading to the intended destination.

step.content: Hover over the prompt within the chat message.
step.expected: The prompt should display a tooltip or additional information if available.

step.content: Click on the prompt within the chat message.
step.expected: The prompt should trigger the intended action or response within the chat interface.

step.content: Open the application and log in with a valid account.
step.expected: The user is successfully logged in and can access the chat interface.

step.content: Navigate to a chat where another user is active.
step.expected: The chat interface is displayed with the other user's activity visible.

step.content: Send a new message from the other user in the chat.
step.expected: The new message appears in the chat window for both users.

step.content: Minimize or close the chat window and wait for a few seconds.
step.expected: The application should display a notification indicating a new message.

step.content: Click on the notification to open the chat window.
step.expected: The chat window opens, and the new message is visible.

step.content: Navigate to the chat where the message is located.
step.expected: The chat interface should display the message and the user should be able to see the text clearly.

step.content: Select a portion of the text within the chat message.
step.expected: The selected text should be highlighted or otherwise indicated as selected.

step.content: click on the selected text and choose the 'Copy' option from the context menu.
step.expected: The selected text should be copied to the clipboard.

step.content: Paste the copied text into a text editor or another application.
step.expected: The pasted text should match the selected portion of the chat message.

step.content: Navigate to the application's main page.
step.expected: The main page should load successfully.

step.content: Click on the side menu button to expand the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu should expand smoothly without any lag or abrupt movements.

step.content: Hover over the side menu items to observe the hover animations.
step.expected: The side menu items should display a smooth hover animation, such as a color change or shadow effect.

step.content: Click on the side menu button again to collapse the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu should collapse smoothly without any lag or abrupt movements.

step.content: Repeat the process of expanding and collapsing the side menu several times.
step.expected: Each time the side menu is expanded or collapsed, the animation should be smooth and consistent.

step.content: Open the application and ensure the side menu is in its default state (either expanded or collapsed).
step.expected: The side menu is in its default state.

step.content: Click on the side menu toggle button to expand the menu.
step.expected: The side menu expands to show the list of items.

step.content: Navigate to a different section of the application (e.g., Home, History, Settings).
step.expected: The side menu remains expanded.

step.content: Click on the side menu toggle button to collapse the menu.
step.expected: The side menu collapses to hide the list of items.

step.content: Navigate to another section of the application.
step.expected: The side menu remains collapsed.

step.content: Refresh the page and check the state of the side menu.
step.expected: The side menu maintains its previous state (either expanded or collapsed).

step.content: Open the application in a web browser.
step.expected: The application homepage is displayed.

step.content: Press the 'Tab' key to navigate to the side menu.
step.expected: The focus should shift to the side menu.

step.content: Use the arrow keys to navigate through the side menu options.
step.expected: The focus should move to each menu item as the arrow keys are pressed.

step.content: Press 'Enter' to select a menu item.
step.expected: The selected menu item should be activated.

step.content: Use a screen reader (e.g., NVDA, JAWS) to navigate through the menu items.
step.expected: The screen reader should announce the menu items as they are focused.

step.content: Select a menu item using the screen reader commands.
step.expected: The selected menu item should be activated.

step.content: Ensure the side menu can be expanded and collapsed using keyboard shortcuts.
step.expected: The side menu should expand and collapse as expected when the appropriate keyboard shortcuts are used.

step.content: Open the application and expand the left side menu.
step.expected: The side menu should expand and show the list of sections.

step.content: Navigate to the 'Home' section from the side menu.
step.expected: The Home section should open, and the side menu should remain expanded.

step.content: Navigate to the 'History' section from the side menu.
step.expected: The History section should open, and the side menu should remain expanded.

step.content: Navigate to the 'Settings' section from the side menu and select a theme.
step.expected: The Settings section should open, and the side menu should remain expanded.

step.content: Navigate to the 'About' section from the side menu.
step.expected: The About section should open, and the side menu should remain expanded.

step.content: Navigate back to the 'Home' section from the side menu.
step.expected: The Home section should open, and the side menu should still be in the expanded state.

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the Canvas tab.
step.expected: The Canvas tab opens successfully.

step.content: Open the Canvas tab multiple times consecutively.
step.expected: The Canvas tab opens each time without any issues.

step.content: Open another tab (e.g., Home, Settings) and then open the Canvas tab.
step.expected: The Canvas tab opens successfully while another tab is active.

step.content: Close the Canvas tab while another tab is active.
step.expected: The Canvas tab closes successfully without affecting the active tab.

step.content: Attempt to open the Canvas tab without the necessary permissions.
step.expected: A permission denied message should be displayed.

step.content: Simulate a system under heavy load by opening multiple tabs and performing resource-intensive tasks.
step.expected: The Canvas tab should fail to open or display a loading error message.

step.content: Try to open the Canvas tab again after resolving the heavy load condition.
step.expected: The Canvas tab should open successfully once the system returns to normal load conditions.

step.content: Open the Canvas.
step.expected: The Canvas opens successfully.

step.content: Zoom in to the maximum limit.
step.expected: The Canvas zooms in to the maximum limit without any issues.

step.content: Attempt to zoom in further beyond the maximum limit.
step.expected: The Canvas does not zoom in further and displays a message indicating the maximum limit has been reached.

step.content: Zoom out to the minimum limit.
step.expected: The Canvas zooms out to the minimum limit without any issues.

step.content: Attempt to zoom out further beyond the minimum limit.
step.expected: The Canvas does not zoom out further and displays a message indicating the minimum limit has been reached.

step.content: Reset the zoom level.
step.expected: The Canvas resets to the default zoom level.

step.content: Clear the Canvas to make it empty.
step.expected: The Canvas is cleared and is empty.

step.content: Reset the zoom level again.
step.expected: The Canvas resets to the default zoom level, even though the Canvas is empty.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface and click on the 'Send' button without entering any text.
step.expected: The system should display an error message indicating that the message cannot be empty.

step.content: Attempt to send another message by clicking on the 'Send' button with an empty text field.
step.expected: The system should again display an error message stating that the message cannot be empty.

step.content: Verify that the error message is clear and understandable, guiding the user to enter a message before sending.
step.expected: The error message should be visible and provide clear instructions on how to resolve the issue.

step.content: Open the chat interface.
step.expected: The chat interface should open successfully.

step.content: Compose a new message containing special characters such as @, #, $, %, &, *, (, ), +, -, =, ?, !, ~, <, >, |, {, }, [, ], ^, ;, :, ', ", ., ,, /, \, and space.
step.expected: The message should be composed successfully with all special characters intact.

step.content: Send the message.
step.expected: The message should be sent successfully without any errors.

step.content: Check the message in the chat history.
step.expected: The message should appear in the chat history with all special characters preserved.

step.content: Verify that the message is displayed correctly in the recipient's chat.
step.expected: The message should be displayed correctly in the recipient's chat with all special characters intact.

step.content: Open the chat interface.
step.expected: The chat interface is displayed.

step.content: Compose a new message with the maximum allowed length.
step.expected: The message input field accepts the maximum length input without any errors.

step.content: Send the composed message.
step.expected: The message is sent successfully and appears in the chat history.

step.content: Check the message length in the chat history.
step.expected: The message length matches the maximum allowed length and is displayed correctly.

step.content: Verify that the message can be read and interacted with without any issues.
step.expected: The message can be read and interacted with without any issues or truncation.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface.
step.expected: The chat interface is displayed.

step.content: Compose a new message.
step.expected: The message input field is available and ready for typing.

step.content: Attach a file to the message.
step.expected: The file attachment option is available and the file is successfully attached.

step.content: Send the message.
step.expected: The message is sent successfully and the attachment is included.

step.content: Verify the message and attachment in the chat history.
step.expected: The sent message and attachment appear in the chat history.

step.content: Compose a new message and include a link in the text.
step.expected: The link should be visible and correctly formatted in the message text.

step.content: Send the message.
step.expected: The message should be sent successfully without any errors.

step.content: Open the sent message in the chat history.
step.expected: The message should appear as sent with the link included in the text.

step.content: Click on the link in the sent message.
step.expected: The link should open in a new browser tab or window, directing the user to the intended URL.

step.content: Open the chat interface.
step.expected: The chat interface should open successfully.

step.content: Compose a message using markdown syntax, for example: '**Hello World!** This is a test message.'
step.expected: The message should be composed correctly with markdown formatting visible in the editor.

step.content: Send the message.
step.expected: The message should be sent successfully and the markdown formatting should be rendered correctly in the chat.

step.content: Verify the rendered message in the chat.
step.expected: The message should appear with the markdown formatting applied, e.g., 'Hello World!' should be bold and the rest of the text should be normal.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface and click on the chat prompt input field.
step.expected: The chat prompt input field is focused and ready for input.

step.content: Leave the chat prompt input field empty and click the 'Send' button.
step.expected: The system should display an error message or a prompt indicating that the input field is empty.

step.content: Observe the error message or prompt displayed by the system.
step.expected: The error message or prompt should clearly indicate that the chat prompt cannot be sent because the input field is empty.
The chat prompt with special characters is displayed correctly without any errors or unexpected behavior.

step.content: Send the chat prompt to the system.
step.expected: The chat prompt is sent successfully and the system processes it without crashing or displaying errors.

step.content: Verify the response to the chat prompt.
step.expected: The system responds to the chat prompt correctly, and the response is displayed without any errors or unexpected behavior.

step.content: Check if the chat functionality remains intact after sending the chat prompt.
step.expected: The chat functionality remains intact, and users can continue to send and receive messages without any issues.

step.content: Create a new chat prompt with the maximum allowed length.
step.expected: The system should accept the prompt without any errors.

step.content: Submit the chat prompt.
step.expected: The system should successfully submit the chat prompt.

step.content: Verify that the chat prompt is displayed correctly in the chat history.
step.expected: The chat prompt should be displayed in its entirety without any truncation or errors.

step.content: Send a new chat prompt that is slightly longer than the maximum allowed length.
step.expected: The system should display an error message indicating that the prompt exceeds the maximum length.

step.content: Attempt to submit a chat prompt that exceeds the maximum length.
step.expected: The system should not allow the submission and should display an error message.
